body_html:
Oh ok! This is because numpy arrays have float64 data type as default!
With array = numpy.array([0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.8, 0.9, 1.1]).astype(numpy.float32) i have back the original values with tf.decode_raw(tensoraw, tf.float32) (you don't say? :) )

Thank you so much. I don't know if the issue can be closed, or if the decode_raw documentation still needs a better description of the "Returns:" section.

With array = numpy.array([0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.8, 0.9, 1.1]).astype(numpy.float32) i have back the original values with tf.decode_raw(tensoraw, tf.float32) (you don't say? :) )

body:
Oh ok! This is because numpy arrays have float64 data type as default!
With `array = numpy.array([0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.8, 0.9, 1.1]).astype(numpy.float32)` i have back the original values with `tf.decode_raw(tensoraw, tf.float32)` (you don't say? :) )

Thank you so much. I don't know if the issue can be closed, or if the `decode_raw` documentation still needs a better description of the "Returns:" section.
